detaileddescription.para: Constructor.
Destructor.
This method returns the local database instance.
This method returns the storage-shard GUID of the local DBApp.
This method returns the database gateway instance.
This method returns the DBApp's network interface.
This method is called to update the transfer rate average, and should be called periodically.
This method is called when the DBApp hash has been updated.
This method is called to declare that a storage-shard with the given GUID is to be considered dirty, and a transfer cycle is to be restarted on the next opportunity.

parameterdescription.para: The GUID of the storage-shard that is to be considered dirty.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when a transfer has completed.

parameterdescription.para: The time, in seconds, it took to complete the transfer.
If true, then the transfer completed successfully, otherwise false.

detaileddescription.para: This method notifies the DBAppMgr of the current locally transitioned shards.
This method returns the current transfer rate average.
This method returns the number of outstanding transfers.
This method returns the current average transfer-rate.
This method returns the current average transfer-time.
This method returns the current maximum transfer-rate limit.
This method returns whether we are waiting for a fetch operation to complete.
This method notifies the DBAppMgr of the given locally transitioned shards.

parameterdescription.para: The locally transitioned shards to notify the DBAppMgr about.

detaileddescription.para: This class starts the transfer cycle.
This method fills up the available transfer slots with more entities from the cursor.
This method is called when a transfer cycle has completed.
This class oversees transfers between this DBApp's storage-shard to other storage-shards.
